citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female maltese (microchip #900164001625419) had hair loss on the top of its head along with an open wound and
dried up blood surrounding the wound. The licensee had observed the hair loss prior to inspection, but had not observed
the open wound prior to inspection and was not treating the dog.
A tan female Doodle (microchip #900217000187652) was observed to be limping on its left rear leg. There were no
obvious wounds or injuries to the leg during examination. The licensee had not observed this dog to be limping prior to
inspection.
Failure to conduct thorough daily observations to identify health problems and communicate them in a timely manner to
the attending veterinarian can lead to unnecessary pain and lead to serious health problems due to lack of appropriate
treatment. Veterinary care issues must be identified and communicated in a timely manner to the attending veterinarian
so they can be adequately treated by or under the guidance of the attending veterinarian. The licensee must observe all
dogs on a daily basis. Correct starting on 11/21/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female maltese (microchip #900164001625419) had hair loss on the top of its head along with an open wound and 
dried up blood surrounding the wound. The licensee had observed the hair loss prior to inspection, but had not observed 
the open wound prior to inspection and was not treating the dog. 
 
A tan female Doodle (microchip #900217000187652) was observed to be limping on its left rear leg. There were no 
obvious wounds or injuries to the leg during examination. The licensee had not observed this dog to be limping prior to 
inspection. 
 
Failure to conduct thorough daily observations to identify health problems and communicate them in a timely manner to 
the attending veterinarian can lead to unnecessary pain and lead to serious health problems due to lack of appropriate 
treatment. Veterinary care issues must be identified and communicated in a timely manner to the attending veterinarian 
so they can be adequately treated by or under the guidance of the attending veterinarian. The licensee must observe all 
dogs on a daily basis. Correct starting on 11/21/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.
